body_html:
You're right -- almost anything is feedable. I was only thinking about the typical cases I work with. I'll correct my point:
Queues have one feature -- prefetch. And that seemed to be missing from dataset API. Therefore dataset API cannot replace queues now.
Or to summarize, what I want is some reader that can:

  1. take data from Python
  2. prefetch
  3. Let me know I finished 1 pass of the dataset and start another (it can be reset for dataset API, or close-reopen for queues, whatever)

1 may not be a problem -- btw, does the link you post suggest that "feedable iterators" are not "reinitializable"? If that's true, then feed_dict to dataset API isn't really useful.

body:
You're right -- almost anything is feedable. I was only thinking about the typical cases I work with. I'll correct my point:
Queues have one feature -- prefetch. And that seemed to be missing from dataset API. Therefore dataset API cannot replace queues now.
Or to summarize, what I want is some reader that can: 
1. take data from Python 
2. prefetch 
3. Let me know I finished 1 pass of the dataset and start another (it can be reset for dataset API, or close-reopen for queues, whatever)

1 may not be a problem -- btw, does the link you post suggest that "feedable iterators" are not "reinitializable"? If that's true, then feed_dict to dataset API isn't really useful.
